The claim of 1: 219,000 unemployed people in Australia was based on data compiled by the Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS).
The claim was found to be misleading as: unemployed" and "underemployed" were actually compiled by market research company Roy Morgan in January 2018, not the ABS.
The ABS: s most recent employment summary for Australia showed a seasonally-adjusted unemployment figure of 711,500 for June 2019, which is significantly lower than the claim.
The definitions used by Roy Morgan and t: unemployed" and "underemployed" differ, contributing to the discrepancy in their statistics.
